definition: to make an earnest request to (someone) : beg
examples: We earnestly implore you to bow out of the practice of clinical medicine and permit us to get on with our difficult job.
… electronic highway signs implore Californians to "Save Water" and municipalities impose increasingly draconian conservation measures …

definition: to say (something) as a request in a sincere or urgent manner
examples: … accountability has become a watchword of relief agencies around the world, with new guidelines to help donors know that their aid won't be wasted. Give money, Presidents Bush and Clinton implore, and by implication, leave the rest to professionals.

definition: to ask or beg for (something) earnestly
examples: On this repetition of Mr Mantalini's fatal threat, Madame Mantalini wrung her hands, and implored the interference of Ralph Nickleby …

To Neapolitans habitually blending pagan and Christian themes, the volcano also became, through its successive manifestations, a personality against whose rages they implored protection from their patron saint …
